Ad Text:
Our Company

Founded in 1973, the EGR Group is a world-class designer and manufacturer of precision engineered solutions marketed through two divisions – Automotive and Building and Commercial Products.

We expect innovation, both in the products we produce, and in the way we operate.

We cultivate craftsmanship, preserving skills learned over generations.

About the Role

Reporting directly to the Chief Financial Officer, this senior leadership role will focus on providing data and insight to ensure clarity of business performance. 

The Business Performance & Analytics Manager works closely with the CFO and senior and operational leaders to turn financial and operational information into clear, practical insight that supports better decisions. This role is not just about producing reports it is about understanding the business, providing insights, anticipating questions and guiding strategic and operational direction through real data.

What You Will Be Responsible For

Divisional performance reporting

Divisional management reporting including analysis of actual results against budget, forecast, and prior year for sales & margin, production variances, freight, and overheads

Divisional balance sheet reporting

Preparation of reporting packs, including clear commentary and performance analysis highlighting issues, risks and recommendations

Planning and forecasting

Coordination and preparation of Group consolidated budget and forecasts including commentary on key assumptions and risks

Engaging with divisional leaders across the Group to gather contributions and ensure alignment of assumptions

Assisting and facilitating divisional leaders’ preparation of bottom-up detailed forecasts ensuring they reflect operational reality

KPIs, dashboards, and analytics

Working with business leaders to develop new reporting of key performance metrics aligned to business priorities

Building and maintaining KPM reporting using Power BI, Excel and other platforms as available

Improving automation through integration of systems to reduce manual effort and improve timeliness

Business partnering

Partnering closely with Managing Directors, General Managers, Sales, and Operations leaders

Supporting monthly performance reviews and providing decision support for key initiatives

Processes and systems

Acting as steward of the operational accounting and reporting model and hierarchies

Working closely with other areas of Finance and IT to ensure systems meet business requirements in delivering accurate, useful and timely information

Improving the quality, consistency and timeliness of management reporting

About You

You are an experienced finance professional with a proven track record of achieving results through analysis and commercial insight.

You will have:

At least 5–7 years’ experience in senior business performance, Financial Planning and Analysis, commercial finance, or business partnering roles.

A degree in Accounting, Finance, or Commerce

CA or CPA qualification preferred

Demonstrated experience using financial and operational analysis to influence decisions and improve business outcomes

Experience leading or coordinating budgeting, forecasting, and long-range planning in a complex or operational environment

Experience providing financial support to senior leaders across a diverse business

Demonstrated developing performance reporting that has driven action

Experience in Power BI or other reporting platforms

Excellent communication skills enabling you to provide financial clarity to non financial leaders

The confidence to challenge assumptions and provide honest, constructive advice

You are practical, commercially minded, and comfortable being accountable. You focus on outcomes, not just analysis, and you enjoy helping a business perform better through clear thinking and sound judgement.

EGR supports growth, development, and long-term stability across the organisation. We are built on collaboration, open communication, and strong working relationships.

If this sounds like a role you would enjoy and be well-suited to, please apply below.

For further information, you can email vharris@egr.com.au

The Opportunity

This is a strong opportunity for an analytically minded FP&A Analyst to join a high performing finance team on an initial 6-month contract, created by an internal move. The role offers meaningful exposure to senior stakeholders, board level reporting and commercially focused financial analysis, with a clear pathway to permanency for the right candidate.

The position combines foundational accounting with a strong FP&A focus. While there is a small accounting component, the emphasis is firmly on high quality analysis, understanding performance drivers and producing accurate, well reconciled financial insights that support decision making. This role suits someone who enjoys working close to the numbers, improving the quality and robustness of analysis, and presenting clear, senior ready outputs in a fast paced environment.

Perks

Initial 6-month contract with strong potential to go permanent
Exposure to senior leadership and board level reporting
Hands on FP&A role with genuine analytical depth
Opportunity to improve and uplift existing reporting and analysis
Immediate start in new year
The Role

Key responsibilities include:

Deliver detailed P&L analysis, including Volume, Price and Mix
Develop a deep understanding of underlying business performance drivers
Prepare high quality senior management and board level reporting packs
Build waterfall analysis and performance bridge reporting
Reconcile all analytical outputs back to source systems and financial data
Identify and improve gaps in accuracy, robustness and consistency of analysis
Post P&L accrual journals and support month end reporting
Ensure integrity, completeness and accuracy of financial information
The Expertise

Please consider expressing interest in this position if you possess the following:

CA /CPA qualification or equivalent
Strong FP&A and analytical capability
High attention to detail with a strong focus on accuracy
Experience producing polished, senior ready financial outputs
Advanced Excel and strong analytical skills
Commercial mindset with the ability to work autonomously
For a confidential conversation, click APPLY.
